tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Heaven and earth announce this in their silent language. Mount Tur is that mountain in the desert of Sinai where Moses was awarded prophethood
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah At-Tur, Ayah 2?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The negligence and arrogance of those who do not come to their senses now with the forewarning, will ultimately suffer grievous punishment. Man will have to face the result of his actions
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who prove to have this very great virtue deserve to have the doors to the eternal blessings of Paradise thrown open to them. Similarly, the greatest virtue of man is his acceptance of Truth
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the Hereafter, it will not happen that one man’s sins are attributed to another, and nobody will be able to enter Paradise except on the basis of his faith and his own righteous deeds
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When a man has no argument against the call of Truth, and yet he does not want to accept it, he starts denigrating the personality of the preacher of Truth
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: People do not earnestly and actively believe that they will have to face any reckoning in the Hereafter. If a man has a firm belief in the reward for good deeds, he will immediately understand matters which he hitherto found extremely difficult to appreciate
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In view of this, if they have the feeling that the preacher of Truth wants to take some material thing from them, they immediately shy away from him. That is why a preacher of Truth never allows any material demand to crop up between his addressees and himself
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah At-Tur, Ayah 44?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: They were not convinced that the rejection of the person who was before them and who was apparently just like them could be so great a crime as to bring down a mountain of destruction upon them
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When this limit is reached, God’s decision is made manifest; this in practice clarifies the difference between Truth and untruth, which had earlier been merely a matter of theory
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event
